 @dev To be used only by the owner and only on extreme situations

@dev Approve one transaction from sender to caller and add the amount to my current account balance. 
 @param transactionId The ID of the transaction to be accepted. The transaction must be in pending state

@dev Deny one transaction from sender and add the amount to back to the sender current account balance. 
 @param transactionId The ID of the transaction to be accepted. The transaction must be in pending state

approveTransaction(uint256,uint8).details: Approve one transaction from sender to caller and add the amount to my current account balance.

params.transactionId: The ID of the transaction to be accepted. The transaction must be in pending state

credit(uint256).details: Credit my account by amount. Updated balances will be returnedThe user must have enough funds in his credit account

params.amount: The amount to be added to the current account..

debit(uint256).details: Debit my account by amount. Updated balances will be returnedThe user must have enough funds in his current account

params.amount: The amount to be deducted from the current account..

deposit(uint256).details: Make a deposit. Updated balances will be returnedThe user must have enough funds in his current account

kill().details: Self Destruct a contract for blockchain.To be used only by the owner and only on extreme situations

name().details: Get the token name. Could be useful for apps UI

rejectTransaction(uint256).details: Deny one transaction from sender and add the amount to back to the sender current account balance.

params.transactionId: The ID of the transaction to be accepted. The transaction must be in pending state

sender().details: Get the address of who is calling the function. Could be useful for debuging.

setBankBalance(address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Set bank balances. Useful for the bank to synchronize balances between the bank and the blockchain network

params.account: The user account address to be set.

symbol().details: Get the token symbol. Could be useful for apps UI

totalRecivedTransactions().details: Get the number of transactions that was received by who is calling this function.Useful for looping between transactions.

totalSentTransactions().details: Get the number of transactions that was sent by who is calling this function.Useful for looping between transactions.

transactionReceived(uint256).details: Get transaction metadata received by the caller of the function.

params.recipient: The recipient account to be queried.

transactionSent(uint256).details: Get transaction metadata sent by the caller of the function.

params.recipient: The recipient account to be queried.

transfer(address,uint256,uint8).details: Transfer token to a specified address. Sender must have at least the amount requested to be transfered

withdraw(uint256).details: Withdraw from deposit. Updated balances will be returnedThe user must have enough funds in his deposit account
